channel.title: BUpolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUpolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: It’s still the economy: What TV ads tell us about each campaign’s closing message
item.description: The final paid messages: Economy, culture wars and character.

item.title: A Connecticut town that swung toward Trump offers clues for Democrats
item.description: Even in the Naugatuck Valley, a Democratic area in a blue state, economic frustrations pushed some voters toward the Republican nominee

item.title: There’s a Reason Harris’ Campaign Is Locked in on Quick Fixes
item.description: The Democratic nominee isn’t campaigning much on the Biden administration’s bigger, slower-moving policies.

item.title: Harris is pounding Trump on fascism. Some Dems think that’s a mistake.
item.description: Harris has ratcheted up her warnings about the dangers of a second Trump term in recent weeks.

item.title: Building Apple Products Has Become a Side Hustle for China's Biggest EV Maker
item.description: BYD has grown into a top iPad assembler and has put around 100,000 people to work for Tim Cook’s company.

item.title: Biden's Farewell to China's Tech Sector: A New Type of Forbidden Chip
item.description: The export of memory chips used in AI applications is restricted, but a delayed announcement gave Chinese companies the chance to stock up.

item.title: Potential conflicts of interest may haunt Dr. Oz’s confirmation to run Medicare, Medicaid
item.description: Dr. Oz has extolled Ozempic’s promise for weight-loss. Now Medicare, which Trump wants Oz to oversee, may cover it.

item.title: Huckabee pick as Israeli ambassador reflects long evangelical alliance
item.description: Former pastor and Arkansas governor Mike Huckabee has pressed, along with other evangelicals, a bond with Israel rooted in biblical prophesy
